Sentencas: Air plasma spraying has been used to produce porous composite anodes based on Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 (SDC) and Cu for use in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Air plasma spray processing and electrochemical characterization of Cu-SDC coatings for use in solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Preliminarily, a range of plasma conditions has been examined for the production of composite coatings from pre-mixed SDC and CuO powders.
Titulo: Air plasma spray processing and electrochemical characterization of Cu-SDC coatings for use in solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Plasma gas compositions were varied to obtain a range of plasma temperatures.
Titulo: Air plasma spray processing and electrochemical characterization of Cu-SDC coatings for use in solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: After reduction in H-2, coatings were characterized for composition and microstructure using EDX and SEM.
Titulo: Air plasma spray processing and electrochemical characterization of Cu-SDC coatings for use in solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: As a result of these tests, symmetrical sintered electrolyte-supported anode-anode cells were fabricated by air plasma spraying of the anodes, followed by in situ reduction of the CuO to Cu.
Titulo: Air plasma spray processing and electrochemical characterization of Cu-SDC coatings for use in solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Full cells deposited on SS430 porous substrates were then produced in one integrated process.
Titulo: Air plasma spray processing and electrochemical characterization of Cu-SDC coatings for use in solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Fine CuO and SDC powders have been used to produce homogeneously mixed anode coatings with higher surface area microstructures, resulting in area-specific polarization resistances of 4.8 Omega cm(2) in impedance tests in hydrogen at 712 degrees C. (c) 2009
Titulo: Air plasma spray processing and electrochemical characterization of Cu-SDC coatings for use in solid oxide fuel cell anodes
Air plasma spray processing and electrochemical characterization of Cu-SDC coatings for use in solid oxide fuel cell anodes
